title: Manchester United agree deal to sell starlet Zidane Iqbal in €1million deal to Utrecht | Football
body_text:
Manchester United have agreed a deal to sell midfield starlet Zidane Iqbal to Utrecht.
The academy graduate, who made his only senior appearance for United in a Champions League group stage clash against Young Boys in 2021, has agreed a four-year deal with the Dutch side, The Athletic report.
United have agreed a fee of €1million (£850,000) that also includes a ‘significant’ sell-on clause.
The 20-year-old midfielder impressed during United’s pre-season campaign last summer but did not manage a single minute of senior football during the 2022-23 campaign, making the match day squad on 17 occasions.
He has made three appearances at international level for Iraq.
United are hoping to offload a number of players this summer to help raise additional transfer funds.
Fulham are interested in signing midfielder Fred who has one year remaining on his current deal at Old Trafford.

Scott McTominay is another who could be moved on if the right offer comes in with Newcastle United among the sides to have shown interest in the 26-year-old.
Dean Henderson and Harry Maguire could also help United refill the coffers with Nottingham Forest in talks to sign the goalkeeper with United hoping to get £25m.
More Trending
Maguire meanwhile has attracted interest from a number of Premier League sides having lost his place in the starting XI but could yet stay at Old Trafford and fight to his place.
Eric Bailly, Alex Telles, Anthony Elanga and Brandon Williams are also among those who could be offloaded with Anthony Martial’s future also uncertain.
Phil Jones and Axel Tuanzebe will leave the club when their respective contracts expire at the end of the month.
